A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Visually stunning\, but the comedy falls flat and feels forced half the time. The subplots are half-baked at best\, and there's hardly any character development. While Rian Johnson makes a lot of bold choices with regards to the storyline\, I truly believe that he has written J.J. Abrams into a corner with regards to the Episode IX storyline. My biggest criticism is that this didn't feel like a Star Wars film; rather\, it felt like an indie-comedic-western film with space ships and laser swords thrown in. Oh\, and (**SPOILER ALERT***) the part where Leia uses the Force to float back into the ship like Tinkerbell was pure\, 100% GARBAGE.
